title: [Large-scale] Elementary Social Education Curriculum Through Online Collaborative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Digital Literacy and Understanding of Fundamental Concepts in Elementary Social Studies
context.additional_context: Real-time online collaborative learning course operating in smartphone-centric restricted technology environments, requiring flexible learning support centered on formative assessment

learning_goals: Learners can perform discussion and resource-sharing activities with peers at over 80% participation using online collaboration tools (Zoom breakout rooms, real-time chat, etc.).

Learners can produce deliverables reflecting at least three rounds of feedback during the design and execution of collaborative projects on social studies topics (e.g., solving local community issues).
Learners create weekly learning logs using a digital collaboration platform (smartphone-optimized web tool) and submit a combination of peer and self-assessments.

resources: Low-Spec Mobile-Optimized Collaboration Board (e.g., Miro Lite)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
